snippet: The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday released its proposal for scrapping a decades-old lifetime ban on blood donation by gay and bisexual men.
abstract: Food and Drug Admin releases proposal for ending lifetime ban on gay and bisexual men donating blood, which will be open to public comment for 60 days; proposal leaves unchanged controversial restriction of donating blood on men who have had sex with men in 12 months.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday released its proposal for scrapping a decades-old lifetime ban on blood donation by gay and bisexual men.

headline.main: F.D.A. Proposal Would End Ban on Blood Donation
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Proposal Would End Ban on Blood Donation
